definition: an official mark stamped on gold and silver articles in England to attest their purity
a mark or device placed or stamped on an article of trade to indicate origin, purity, or genuineness
examples: a hallmark from the Ming dynasty

definition: a distinguishing characteristic, trait, or feature
examples: the dramatic flourishes which are the hallmark of the trial lawyer

definition: to stamp with a mark that indicates origin, purity, or genuineness : to stamp with a hallmark (see hallmark entry 1)
